channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Logan Paul auctions off $5.3 million Pokémon card, urging young people to invest more in nontraditional assets: ‘Don’t be afraid to take a risk’
item.description: Pokémon cards have seen the largest long-term increase in value among all card categories.

item.title: Gen Z founder on ‘AI anxiety’ and being pigeonholed as generation shortcut: that’s the ‘biggest misconception’
item.description: "We don't really know what to do but we know it's coming and nobody is moving as fast to solve the problem," said Kiara Nirghin. AI or climate anxiety...

item.title: How classy Jell-O shots became the boozy treat of the season
item.description: This holiday season, an unexpected treat has stepped into the limelight and onto the buffet table at many a festive gathering: the Jell-O shot. But th...

item.title: What’s open on Christmas Day: Holiday hours for fast-food chains, grocery stores, CVS, and more
item.description: It’s normal—perhaps even biological—to slow down at the end of the year. Winter weather brings less sunlight, causing our bodies to produce more melat...

item.title: Amazon’s Alexa chief predicts an end to doom scrolling: the next generation is ‘going to just think differently’
item.description: "You've got to make sure you have products in their pockets, on their bodies, in their homes that they don't expect," Panos Panay said at Brainstorm A...

item.title: How Zara Fought Off Shein and Outmaneuvered the Ultra-Fast Fashion Tide
item.description: AI allowed Shein not just to outpace everyone but to rewrite the physics of trend creation itself. Yet Zara has managed to hold its own.

item.title: Meet the millionaires living the ‘underconsumption’ life: They drive secondhand cars, batch cook, and never buy new clothes
item.description: From thrifted clothes to no gifts at the holidays, these millionaires are living an 'underconsumption' life which has opened up financial freedom.

item.title: Why Apple and Google want your ID

item.title: How This Family Business Went Viral Using Old School Advertising
item.description: Red Wing Shoe Company pulled off a twist on a traditional marketing tactic.

item.title: Finding Calm in Chaos: How Leaders Can Thrive Amid Industry Uncertainty
item.description: In turbulent times, leadership gets tested. Here’s how to pull through and flourish.

item.title: Google Co-Founder Explains One of the Company’s Most Infamous Failures
item.description: He shared a key piece of advice for beginner entrepreneurs.

item.title: Giant homebuilder KB Home shifts strategy amid a housing market where it lacks pricing power

item.title: Top 12 productivity books of 2025 to change your relationship with work and time
item.description: Somewhere between endless meetings and half-finished projects, we all went looking for better ways to get things done this year. These are the 2025 ti...

item.title: Apple’s Boldest Wins—and Most Brutal Losses—This Year
item.description: From iPhones to AI to a new design language, these were Apple’s hits and misses this year.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg gifted noise-canceling headphones to his Palo Alto neighbors because of the nonstop construction around his 11 homes
item.description: This isn’t the first time Zuckerberg has clashed with neighbors over real estate projects.
